thread.title: Tim Tebow answers how he's 'managed to avoid all these thots?'
thread.title_full: Tim Tebow answers how he's 'managed to avoid all these thots?'

author: Nick Birdsong (nbirdsong@sportingnews.com)
title: Tim Tebow answers how he's 'managed to avoid all these thots?'
text:
February 7, 2017 4:18pm   4:01pm EST A devout Christian, the 29-year-old virgin explains to radio show caller how he's remained pure amid football fame. Tim Tebow (Getty Images) 
Updated at 4:18 p.m. ET 
Updated at 4:18 p.m. ET 
Seemingly, for as long as Tim Tebow has been in the national spotlight, there's been a weird fascination with his sex life, or lack thereof. 
It all started back in 2009. 
Tebow was the Heisman-trophy, national-championship winning quarterback at the University of Florida and a bonafide heartthrob. A devout Christian, Tebow lived out his faith, boldly proclaiming it in both victory and defeat as well spending his off time on missions trips in the Philippines. So, a sportswriter decided to take his line of questioning between the sheets and ask Tebow if he was saving himself for marriage at SEC Media Days prior to the start of his senior season. Tebow laughed briefly, then answered succinctly, "Yes, I am." 
It was an odd (read: irrelevant) inquiry. Yet, in the age of increasing social media voyeurism, the now 29-year-old and still unmarried Tebow is often asked about the status of his purity. Such was the case last week in Houston when a caller to a Super Bowl LI radio show asked the NFL journeyman, "Hey, Tim. How have you managed to avoid all these thots out here all these years bro," the caller asked. "Especially down there in Florida, the University of Florida, Come on bud. I played baseball in college. I been down there. I don't know how you managed not to start smashing down there bro." 
MORE: The best Super Bowl teams ranked 1-51 
For those unfamiliar with the term, Urban Dictionary can furnish you with a definition . Beware before clicking, it contains language that isn't suitable for work or children. 
Tebow handled the crass question with even more class and aplomb than he displayed nearly eight years ago. 
"I think, for me, it's just staying focused on certain things. "I think, when your focus is on certain things that matter, for me, my faith, loving people, helping people, caring for people, it's not about focusing on the things that you're not gonna do. It's about focusing on the things you are gonna do." Watch This
